fields.summary: Document new instance commands created in 3.3

comments.body: [~scottb], I reassigned this to you, because I think you've already been working on it. Let me know if that is not the case.
Does this have anything to do with DOC-794, which is updating the CLI guide for the AWS compatibility changes to Euca2ools?

Yes. Toward the end of 3.3.0, we created some Eucalyptus-specific commands:
 - euca-describe-instance-types
 - euca-modify-instance-types

From the commit:

commit 69b0edf1a710421b375ab28a69c2f34cb5b7ff77
Author: chris grzegorczyk <grze@eucalyptus.com>
Date:   Wed May 15 11:58:40 2013 -0700

   Fixes to instance type handling, syntax, ordering

   Changes are properly persisted and re-read from the database.
   So, a modify will be saved, and after failover/upgrade/restart
   be re-read correctly.

   Along with this persisting of changes using the UI is fixed.

   The name of the operations are now fixed to be InstanceType
   rather than VmType.  Corresponding adjust made in euca2ools
   and included here are for the console and autoscaling.

   Type ordering restriction is relaxed in the following way:
   - Instance types are not /required/ to be partial ordered
   - Instances types which are /not/ partially ordered are
     treated as a degenerate case.
   - The system determines the set of partially ordered types
     and as long as run-instance requests during a duty cycle
     only refer to ordered types the system behaves as it did
     before.
   - Should an unordered type be requested, or be inflight when
     any other run-instance request arrives, the request will
     be preceded by and immediately followed by a CC downcall
     to update resource state information.  Note that only the
     preceding resource state update happens synchronously.
   - The state updates must happen whenever there is an as-yet-
     unfulfilled request that references an unordered type.
     Otherwise, the ordered type resource accounting is skewed.
   - Below is a script for computing the set of conflicting or
     unordered instance types and could serve as the basis for
     future enhancement to tighten up resource accounting and
     perhaps allow removing the synchronous special case update.

   This functionality supercedes the previous approach using
   'euca-describe-availability-zones verbose' which will be
   deprecated in a subsequent release.

##################################################
# Install pre-reqs
yum install /usr/bin/easy_install
easy_install argparse
easy_install requestbuilder

##################################################
# Get the right branch of euca2ools installed
git clone -b requestbuilder https://github.com/eucalyptus/euca2ools
cd euca2ools
python setup.py install

##################################################
# Check and see we have two clusters each w/ an NC
22:31:03 :( root@eucahost-51-72:~/euca2ools ):
euca2ools 80 > euca-describe-services -T cluster; euca-describe-services -T node --all
SERVICE cluster         PARTI00         CC_72           ENABLED         36      http://192.168.51.72:8774/axis2/services/EucalyptusCC   arn:euca:eucalyptus:PARTI00:cluster:CC_72/
SERVICE cluster         PARTI01         CC_135          ENABLED         36      http://10.111.1.135:8774/axis2/services/EucalyptusCC    arn:euca:eucalyptus:PARTI01:cluster:CC_135/
SERVICE node            PARTI00         192.168.51.74   ENABLED         36      http://192.168.51.74:8775/axis2/services/EucalyptusNC   arn:euca:bootstrap:PARTI00:node:192.168.51.74/
SERVICE node            PARTI01         10.111.5.5      ENABLED         36      http://10.111.5.5:8775/axis2/services/EucalyptusNC      arn:euca:bootstrap:PARTI01:node:10.111.5.5/

##################################################
# Perform a basic describe operation which shows all the instance types defined in the cloud
22:22:01 :( root@eucahost-51-72:~/euca_builder/eee/eucalyptus/clc ):
clc 103 > euca-describe-instance-types
# I skip the output because it is quite long.
# Below are briefer examples.
# The last example includes all instance type output across all zones w/ capacity information.

##################################################
# Perform a describe operation for only certain types
22:48:01 :( root@eucahost-51-72:~/euca_builder/eee/eucalyptus/clc ):
clc 106 > euca-describe-instance-types m1.small c1.xlarge
INSTANCETYPE    Name       CPUs  Memory (MB)  Disk (GB)
INSTANCETYPE    m1.small      1          256          5
INSTANCETYPE    c1.xlarge     2         2048         10

##################################################
# Perform a describe operation which shows a cloud-wide aggregate view of instance type availability/capacity
22:47:42 :( root@eucahost-51-72:~/euca_builder/eee/eucalyptus/clc ):
clc 104 > euca-describe-instance-types --show-capacity m1.small c1.xlarge
INSTANCETYPE    Name       CPUs  Memory (MB)  Disk (GB)  Used / Total  Used %
INSTANCETYPE    m1.small      1          256          5     0 /     8      0%
INSTANCETYPE    c1.xlarge     2         2048         10     0 /     4      0%

##################################################
# Update the disk sizing of m1.small -- other dimensions which can be altered are CPU and memory for now.
# More to come in future releases.
22:48:19 :( root@eucahost-51-72:~/euca_builder/eee/eucalyptus/clc ):
clc 107 > euca-modify-instance-type -d 15 m1.small
INSTANCETYPE    m1.small        1       256     15

##################################################
# Note now that 'm1.small' is no longer partially ordered wrt the other instance types
22:50:36 :( root@eucahost-51-72:~/euca_builder/eee/eucalyptus/clc ):
clc 108 > euca-describe-instance-types m1.small c1.xlarge
INSTANCETYPE    Name       CPUs  Memory (MB)  Disk (GB)
INSTANCETYPE    c1.xlarge     2         2048         10
INSTANCETYPE    m1.small      1          256         15


##################################################
# Put m1.small back the way he was, see the change.
22:50:38 :( root@eucahost-51-72:~/euca_builder/eee/eucalyptus/clc ):
clc 108 > euca-modify-instance-type -d 5 m1.small
INSTANCETYPE    m1.small        1       256     5
22:51:17 :( root@eucahost-51-72:~/euca_builder/eee/eucalyptus/clc ):
clc 110 > euca-describe-instance-types m1.small
INSTANCETYPE    Name       CPUs  Memory (MB)  Disk (GB)
INSTANCETYPE    m1.small      1          256          5

##################################################
# Perform a describe operation which shows a per-cluster view of instance type availability/capacity
22:47:43 :( root@eucahost-51-72:~/euca_builder/eee/eucalyptus/clc ):
clc 105 > euca-describe-instance-types --show-capacity --by-zone m1.small c1.xlarge
AVAILABILITYZONE        PARTI00
INSTANCETYPE    Name       CPUs  Memory (MB)  Disk (GB)  Used / Total  Used %
INSTANCETYPE    m1.small      1          256          5     0 /     4      0%
INSTANCETYPE    c1.xlarge     2         2048         10     0 /     2      0%

AVAILABILITYZONE        PARTI01
INSTANCETYPE    Name       CPUs  Memory (MB)  Disk (GB)  Used / Total  Used %
INSTANCETYPE    m1.small      1          256          5     0 /     4      0%
INSTANCETYPE    c1.xlarge     2         2048         10     0 /     2      0%
